00128 const static sha2_word64 sha384_initial_hash_value[8] = {
00129         0xcbbb9d5dc1059ed8ULL,
00130         0x629a292a367cd507ULL,
00131         0x9159015a3070dd17ULL,

00151 /*
00152  *  * Constant used by SHA256/384/512_End() functions for converting the
00153  *   * digest to a readable hexadecimal character string:
00154  *    */
00155 static const char *sha2_hex_digits = "0123456789abcdef";

00163 void SHA2ext::SHA512_Init(SHA512_CTX* context) 
00164 {
00165         if (context == (SHA512_CTX*)0) {
00166                 return;
00167         }
00168         MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->state, sha512_initial_hash_value, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00169         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00170         context->bitcount[0] = context->bitcount[1] =  0;
00171 }
00172 
00173 #ifdef SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM
00174 
00175 /* Unrolled SHA-512 round macros: */
00176 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00177 
00178 #define ROUND512_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00179         REVERSE64(*data++, W512[j]); \
00180         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00181              K512[j] + W512[j]; \
00182         (d) += T1, \
00183         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_512(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)), \
00184         j++
00185 
00186 
00187 #else /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00188 
00189 #define ROUND512_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00190         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00191              K512[j] + (W512[j] = *data++); \
00192         (d) += T1; \
00193         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_512(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00194         j++
00195 
00196 #endif /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00197 
00198 #define ROUND512(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00199         s0 = W512[(j+1)&0x0f]; \
00200         s0 = sigma0_512(s0); \
00201         s1 = W512[(j+14)&0x0f]; \
00202         s1 = sigma1_512(s1); \
00203         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + K512[j] + \
00204              (W512[j&0x0f] += s1 + W512[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0); \
00205         (d) += T1; \
00206         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_512(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00207         j++
00208 
00214 void SHA2ext::SHA512_Transform(SHA512_CTX* context, const sha2_word64* data) {
00215         sha2_word64     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00216         sha2_word64     T1, *W512 = (sha2_word64*)context->buffer;
00217         int             j;
00218 
00219         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00220         a = context->state[0];
00221         b = context->state[1];
00222         c = context->state[2];
00223         d = context->state[3];
00224         e = context->state[4];
00225         f = context->state[5];
00226         g = context->state[6];
00227         h = context->state[7];
00228 
00229         j = 0;
00230         do {
00231                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00232                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00233                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00234                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00235                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00236                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00237                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00238                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00239         } while (j < 16);
00240 
00241         /* Now for the remaining rounds up to 79: */
00242         do {
00243                 ROUND512(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00244                 ROUND512(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00245                 ROUND512(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00246                 ROUND512(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00247                 ROUND512(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00248                 ROUND512(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00249                 ROUND512(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00250                 ROUND512(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00251         } while (j < 80);
00252 
00253         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00254         context->state[0] += a;
00255         context->state[1] += b;
00256         context->state[2] += c;
00257         context->state[3] += d;
00258         context->state[4] += e;
00259         context->state[5] += f;
00260         context->state[6] += g;
00261         context->state[7] += h;
00262 
00263         /* Clean up */
00264         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = 0;
00265 }
00266 
00267 #else /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00268 
00274 void SHA2ext::SHA512_Transform(SHA512_CTX* context, const sha2_word64* data) {
00275         sha2_word64     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00276         sha2_word64     T1, T2, *W512 = (sha2_word64*)context->buffer;
00277         int             j;
00278 
00279         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00280         a = context->state[0];
00281         b = context->state[1];
00282         c = context->state[2];
00283         d = context->state[3];
00284         e = context->state[4];
00285         f = context->state[5];
00286         g = context->state[6];
00287         h = context->state[7];
00288 
00289         j = 0;
00290         do {
00291 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00292                 /* Convert TO host byte order */
00293                 REVERSE64(*data++, W512[j]);
00294                 /* Apply the SHA-512 compression function to update a..h */
00295                 T1 = h + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K512[j] + W512[j];
00296 #else /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00297                 /* Apply the SHA-512 compression function to update a..h with copy */
00298                 T1 = h + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K512[j] + (W512[j] = *data++);
00299 #endif /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00300                 T2 = Sigma0_512(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00301                 h = g;
00302                 g = f;
00303                 f = e;
00304                 e = d + T1;
00305                 d = c;
00306                 c = b;
00307                 b = a;
00308                 a = T1 + T2;
00309 
00310                 j++;
00311         } while (j < 16);
00312 
00313         do {
00314                 /* Part of the message block expansion: */
00315                 s0 = W512[(j+1)&0x0f];
00316                 s0 = sigma0_512(s0);
00317                 s1 = W512[(j+14)&0x0f];
00318                 s1 =  sigma1_512(s1);
00319 
00320                 /* Apply the SHA-512 compression function to update a..h */
00321                 T1 = h + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K512[j] +
00322                      (W512[j&0x0f] += s1 + W512[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0);
00323                 T2 = Sigma0_512(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00324                 h = g;
00325                 g = f;
00326                 f = e;
00327                 e = d + T1;
00328                 d = c;
00329                 c = b;
00330                 b = a;
00331                 a = T1 + T2;
00332 
00333                 j++;
00334         } while (j < 80);
00335 
00336         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00337         context->state[0] += a;
00338         context->state[1] += b;
00339         context->state[2] += c;
00340         context->state[3] += d;
00341         context->state[4] += e;
00342         context->state[5] += f;
00343         context->state[6] += g;
00344         context->state[7] += h;
00345 
00346         /* Clean up */
00347         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = T2 = 0;
00348 }
00349 #endif /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00350 
00351 void SHA2ext::SHA512_Update(SHA512_CTX* context, const sha2_byte *data, unsigned int len) {
00352         unsigned int    freespace, usedspace;
00353 
00354         if (len == 0) {
00355                 /* Calling with no data is valid - we do nothing */
00356                 return;
00357         }
00358 
00359         /* Sanity check: */
00360         assert(context != (SHA512_CTX*)0 && data != (sha2_byte*)0);
00361 
00362         usedspace = (context->bitcount[0] >> 3) % SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00363         if (usedspace > 0) {
00364                 /* Calculate how much free space is available in the buffer */
00365                 freespace = SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace;
00366 
00367                 if (len >= freespace) {
00368                         /* Fill the buffer completely and process it */
00369                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, freespace);
00370                         ADDINC128(context->bitcount, freespace << 3);
00371                         len -= freespace;
00372                         data += freespace;
00373                         SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)context->buffer);
00374                 } else {
00375                         /* The buffer is not yet full */
00376                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, len);
00377                         ADDINC128(context->bitcount, len << 3);
00378                         /* Clean up: */
00379                         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00380                         return;
00381                 }
00382         }
00383         while (len >= SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00384                 /* Process as many complete blocks as we can */
00385                 SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)data);
00386                 ADDINC128(context->bitcount, SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH << 3);
00387                 len -= SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00388                 data += SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00389         }
00390         if (len > 0) {
00391                 /* There's left-overs, so save 'em */
00392                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->buffer, data, len);
00393                 ADDINC128(context->bitcount, len << 3);
00394         }
00395         /* Clean up: */
00396         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00397 }
00398 
00399 void SHA2ext::SHA512_Last(SHA512_CTX* context) 
00400 {
00401         unsigned int    usedspace;
00402 
00403         usedspace = (context->bitcount[0] >> 3) % SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00404 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00405         /* Convert FROM host byte order */
00406         REVERSE64(context->bitcount[0],context->bitcount[0]);
00407         REVERSE64(context->bitcount[1],context->bitcount[1]);
00408 #endif
00409         if (usedspace > 0) {
00410                 /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00411                 context->buffer[usedspace++] = 0x80;
00412 
00413                 if (usedspace <= SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00414                         /* Set-up for the last transform: */
00415                         MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00416                 } else {
00417                         if (usedspace < SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00418                                 MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00419                         }
00420                         /* Do second-to-last transform: */
00421                         SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)context->buffer);
00422 
00423                         /* And set-up for the last transform: */
00424                         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - 2);
00425                 }
00426         } else {
00427                 /* Prepare for final transform: */
00428                 MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00429 
00430                 /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00431                 *context->buffer = 0x80;
00432         }
00433         /* Store the length of input data (in bits): */
00434         *(sha2_word64*)&context->buffer[SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH] = context->bitcount[1];
00435         *(sha2_word64*)&context->buffer[SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH+8] = context->bitcount[0];
00436 
00437         /* Final transform: */
00438         SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)context->buffer);
00439 }
00440 
00441 void SHA2ext::SHA512_Final(sha2_byte digest[], SHA512_CTX* context) 
00442 {
00443         sha2_word64     *d = (sha2_word64*)digest;
00444 
00445         /* Sanity check: */
00446         assert(context != (SHA512_CTX*)0);
00447 
00448         /* If no digest buffer is passed, we don't bother doing this: */
00449         if (digest != (sha2_byte*)0) {
00450                 SHA512_Last(context);
00451 
00452                 /* Save the hash data for output: */
00453 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00454                 {
00455                         /* Convert TO host byte order */
00456                         int     j;
00457                         for (j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00458                                 REVERSE64(context->state[j],context->state[j]);
00459                                 *d++ = context->state[j];
00460                         }
00461                 }
00462 #else
00463                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(d, context->state, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00464 #endif
00465         }
00466 
00467         /* Zero out state data */
00468         MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00469 }
00470 
00471 char* SHA2ext::SHA512_End(SHA512_CTX* context, char buffer[]) 
00472 {
00473         sha2_byte       digest[SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH], *d = digest;
00474         int             i;
00475 
00476         /* Sanity check: */
00477         assert(context != (SHA512_CTX*)0);
00478 
00479         if (buffer != (char*)0) {
00480                 SHA512_Final(digest, context);
00481 
00482                 for (i = 0; i < SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++) {
00483                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[(*d & 0xf0) >> 4];
00484                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[*d & 0x0f];
00485                         d++;
00486                 }
00487                 *buffer = (char)0;
00488         } else {
00489                 MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00490         }
00491         MEMSET_BZERO(digest, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00492         return buffer;
00493 }
00494 
00495 void SHA2ext::SHA384_Init(SHA384_CTX* context) 
00496 {
00497         if (context == (SHA384_CTX*)0) {
00498                 return;
00499         }
00500         MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->state, sha384_initial_hash_value, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00501         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA384_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00502         context->bitcount[0] = context->bitcount[1] = 0;
00503 }
00504 
00505 void SHA2ext::SHA384_Update(SHA384_CTX* context, const sha2_byte* data, unsigned int len) 
00506 {
00507         SHA512_Update((SHA512_CTX*)context, data, len);
00508 }
00509 
00510 void SHA2ext::SHA384_Final(sha2_byte digest[], SHA384_CTX* context) 
00511 {
00512         sha2_word64     *d = (sha2_word64*)digest;
00513 
00514         /* Sanity check: */
00515         assert(context != (SHA384_CTX*)0);
00516 
00517         /* If no digest buffer is passed, we don't bother doing this: */
00518         if (digest != (sha2_byte*)0) {
00519                 SHA512_Last((SHA512_CTX*)context);
00520 
00521                 /* Save the hash data for output: */
00522 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00523                 {
00524                         /* Convert TO host byte order */
00525                         int     j;
00526                         for (j = 0; j < 6; j++) {
00527                                 REVERSE64(context->state[j],context->state[j]);
00528                                 *d++ = context->state[j];
00529                         }
00530                 }
00531 #else
00532                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(d, context->state, SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00533 #endif
00534         }
00535 
00536         /* Zero out state data */
00537         MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00538 }
00539 
00540 char* SHA2ext::SHA384_End(SHA384_CTX* context, char buffer[]) 
00541 {
00542         sha2_byte       digest[SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH], *d = digest;
00543         int             i;
00544 
00545         /* Sanity check: */
00546         assert(context != (SHA384_CTX*)0);
00547 
00548         if (buffer != (char*)0) {
00549                 SHA384_Final(digest, context);
00550 
00551                 for (i = 0; i < SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++) {
00552                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[(*d & 0xf0) >> 4];
00553                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[*d & 0x0f];
00554                         d++;
00555                 }
00556                 *buffer = (char)0;
00557         } else {
00558                 MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00559         }
00560         MEMSET_BZERO(digest, SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00561         return buffer;
00562 }
